mcq_questions.question: The product of two numbers is 12,320 and their HCF is 28. Find their LCM.
The average of 25 numbers is 36. Later it was found that one number 45 was wrongly taken as 15. What is the correct average?
If 5% of A = 10% of B = 20% of C, then A : B : C is:
The sum of two numbers is 1215 and their HCF is 81. Find the possible LCM.
The difference between the squares of two consecutive odd integers is 56. Find the integers.
The cube root of a number lies between 11 and 12. The number is closest to:
A number is mistakenly divided by 2 instead of being multiplied by 2. The result is 48. What is the correct answer?
If 30% of x = 0.25 of y = 1/5 of z, then x:y:z is:
The average age of 6 students is 20 years. If one new student joins, the average becomes 21. Find the age of the new student.
If the HCF of 2 numbers is 21 and their product is 2079, find their LCM.
The ratio of two numbers is 3:4. If their LCM is 180, find the numbers.
Divide ₹600 into two parts such that the ratio of their squares is 9:16.
If a:b = 2:3 and b:c = 4:5, then a:b:c = ?
The mean proportional between 18 and 32 is:
A and B invest ₹5000 and ₹6000 respectively. After 6 months, A invests ₹2000 more. At the end of the year, the total profit is ₹7800. Find A’s share.
A invests ₹4500 for 4 months, B invests ₹6000 for 6 months. Find the ratio of their profits.
A, B and C invest in the ratio 5:6:8. If the total profit is ₹19,500, what is B’s share?
P invests ₹6000 for 12 months, Q invests ₹8000 for 6 months, and R invests ₹5000 for 9 months. Find the ratio of profits.
X and Y start a business with capitals ₹12,000 and ₹16,000. After 8 months, Y withdraws his money. If the total profit is ₹26,000, find Y’s share.
A can do a piece of work in 18 days and B in 24 days. They work together for 6 days, then A leaves. In how many more days will B finish the work?
If 12 men can do a work in 18 days, how many men will do it in 8 days?
A can complete a work in 20 days, B in 25 days. If they work together for 5 days, then A leaves, how long will B take to finish the remaining work?
A alone can do a work in 30 days, B alone in 40 days. They work together for 10 days, then A leaves. In how many more days will B finish?
If 15 women can complete a job in 12 days, in how many days can 20 women complete the same job?
Pipe A can fill a tank in 15 hours, Pipe B in 20 hours. Both are opened together, but after 4 hours B is closed. In how many more hours will A fill the remaining tank?
A cistern can be filled by a pipe in 12 hours and emptied by a waste pipe in 18 hours. If both are opened together, find the time to fill the cistern.
Two pipes can fill a cistern in 24 and 30 hours respectively. A third pipe can empty it in 40 hours. If all three are opened, how long will it take to fill?
Pipe A can fill a tank in 6 hours, Pipe B can empty it in 8 hours. If both are opened, the tank will be filled in:
Pipe A fills a cistern in 8 hours, Pipe B fills in 12 hours. Both opened together, but 2 hours before the cistern is full, B is closed. Find total time.
A train running at 60 km/h crosses a pole in 9 seconds. Find the length of the train.
A 120m long train crosses a platform of length 180m in 18 seconds. Find speed.
Two trains of lengths 150m and 180m are running in opposite directions at 54 km/h and 72 km/h. Find the time to cross each other.
A car covers 120 km at 40 km/h and returns at 60 km/h. Find average speed.
A boat can travel 15 km downstream in 3 hours and the same distance upstream in 5 hours. Find speed of boat in still water.
A train 360m long crosses a bridge of length 140m in 20 seconds. Find speed.
Two boats travel from A to B downstream in 4 hours. One returns in 5 hours, other in 6 hours. Ratio of their speeds in still water?
A man rows 12 km downstream in 3h and upstream in 4h. Find speed of stream.
A train crosses a 200m platform in 25s and a pole in 15s. Find length of train.
A train 180m long crosses another 120m long train running in opposite directions in 9s. Their speeds are 60 and 48 km/h. Verify time.
A boat travels 30 km downstream in 2h, and the same distance upstream in 3h. Find the speed of boat in still water.
Two trains, 100m and 120m long, moving in same direction at 36 and 54 km/h. Time taken to cross each other?
A 200m train crosses a platform twice its length in 30s. Find speed.
A man rows 30 km downstream in 2h, same distance upstream in 3h. Find speed of stream.
A train crosses a pole in 15s and a bridge 300m in 39s. Find length of train.
In what ratio must water be mixed with milk costing ₹60/litre to get mixture worth ₹45/litre?
Two varieties of rice at ₹30/kg and ₹40/kg are mixed to get mixture at ₹36/kg. Find ratio.
A vessel has 60 litres of milk and water in ratio 3:1. How much water must be added to make ratio 3:2?
In a mixture of 40 litres, the ratio of milk to water is 7:3. How much water must be added to make it 3:2?
Tea worth ₹100/kg is mixed with tea worth ₹150/kg to get mixture at ₹120/kg. Find ratio.
